dogsim
Class Dog

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      dogsim.Dog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Dog
extends java.lang.Thread

Class represents a simulated dog which runs around an Arena. Each dog runs within its own Thread. Each dog is connected to a FitBit which periodically transmits the dog's location and vital signs. The class includes default simulated dog behaviour such as chasing other dogs and resting when tired. Dog's normal and max HRs and temps are fixed, but max speed depends on the dog.

Author:
Karel Bergmann
See Also:
Arena, Thread, FitBit

Constructor Detail

Dog

public Dog(Arena aArena,
           long aHR,
           double aTemp,
           double aMaxSpeed,
           int aId)
Constructor which specifies starting state of Dog.

Parameters:
aSaddleDome - The Arena for dog interactions
aBPM - The dog's current heart rate, must be greater than NORMAL_HR
aTemp - The dog's current temperature, must be greater than or equal NORMAL_TEMP.
aMaxSpeed - The dog's maximum speed (different dogs run faster than others) must be greater than 1;
aId - The dog's ID number
See Also:
Arena
Method Detail

kill

public void kill()
Allows external entity to kill this dog's thread, and thus remove it from the simulation.

run

public void run()
Simulates dog behaviour. Every REFRESH_INTERVAL milliseconds, the dog's temp, HR, direction, position and velocity are updated. The dog's vital signs are transmitted to a RESTful web server by it's FitBit. The loop can be interrupted by a call to Dog.kill().

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
See Also:
FitBit, Dog.kill()

getNORMAL_HR

public static long getNORMAL_HR()

getMAX_HR

public static long getMAX_HR()

updatePosition

private void updatePosition()
Updates a dog's position based on current velocity. The dog's heading is altered by 180 degrees if it hits the edge of the Arena.

See Also:
Arena

updateDirection

private void updateDirection()
Update the dog's direction. The dog will head towards (chase) the nearest dog which is up to 45 degree off of its current heading and in VISUAL_RANGE. If there is no such dog, the dog alters heading by up to 90 degrees.

updateVelocity

private void updateVelocity()
Updates the dog's velocity. If the dog is resting, the dog stops moving. If the dog is chasing, it increases speed by a random factor to a maximum of fMaxSpeed m/update. If a dog is neither chasing, nor resting (active), it's speed is adjusted by a random factor.

updateTemp

private void updateTemp()
Maintains the dog's internal temperature in C. If the dog's velocity is greater than fMaxSpeed, internal temperature is incremented. If the dog isn't moving, temp is decremented. If the temperature exceeds MAX_TEMP the dog stops chasing and starts resting. Internal temp is not allowed to drop below NORMAL_TEMP

updateHR

private void updateHR()
Updates the dog's heart rate. HR increases by 1BPM if dog is above 0.5*max speed. If the dog is resting, HR decreases by 1 BPM. If the dog has rested for NEEDED_REST updates, the dog stops resting. If the dog's HR exceeds MAX_BPM the dog stops chasing, stops moving and starts resting. The dog's HR is not permitted to drop below NORMAL_HR.

heading

private double heading(Dog aDog)
Helper method to calculate the heading required by this Dog to reach aDog in a straight line.

Parameters:
aDog - The target dog.
Returns:
a heading in degrees.

getDogState

public DogState getDogState()
Produces a DogState object with the dog's current vital signs and location.

Returns:
DogState with current vital signs
